text.title: Make a Small Apartment Appear Larger

head.s: Make a Small Apartment Appear Larger

p.s: Have you ever felt that your apartment is too small ?
Or perhaps just smaller than you ’d like ?
There ’s no need to feel cramped – there are many tactics you can use to make a small apartment feel like a comfortable , cozy home .

list.item:
Clear the clutter .
If you ’re struggling with a small space , the first step is to get organized !
When you have your belongings neatly arranged and out of sight , your space will feel orderly and open .
Try mounted wall shelves and storage ottomans to make the most of the space you have – anything that can pull double duty will help make your apartment feel more spacious and organized .

item.s: Decorate with soft , light hues .
Dark , warm colors are often used to make a home feel cozy and intimate , but these colors unfortunately also make rooms feel smaller .
To make your apartment feel larger , use light , cool colors for an open , airy effect .
Soft blues and greens are the most effective , but any light , cool color will add space to your apartment .
For the optimum effect , use a monochromatic color scale , and tie all your decorations into a specific color family .
If you can paint your apartment , make sure the walls are also painted in similarly light colors – light walls will have the largest effect on making the room feel larger .

item.s: Open up floor space .
Move furniture out of walkways , and remove unnecessary furniture .
A few large , useful pieces will help make your space feel larger and cozier .
Move tall furniture against the wall .
When you fill a room with multiple small pieces of furniture , the space begins to feel cramped and uninviting .
The end goal is to show as much floor as possible .
If new furniture is an option , invest in pieces that offer open space underneath , to make the room feel even larger .

figure.rend: Give Your Room a Makeover Step 14.jpg

item.s: Use light to your advantage .
Light-filled rooms will make your apartment feel much larger .
Choose accessories that emit and reflect light .
Floor and table lamps may take up too much space , but track lighting or wall-mounted sconces can provide extra light and elegance to a room .
Hang mirrors on walls that are opposite windows to reflect light into the space and provide extra oomph to the room – space will also be reflected , resulting in a room that feels larger .
Go in the attic and see which walls are supporting walls .
A wall that does not support anything can be removed to increase space .
Be prepared to redo the flooring afterwards .
By following these tactics for decorating a small space , your apartment home will feel comfortable and more spacious .
You ’ll have a creative space that suits all your needs , and lends a refined elegance to any events you hold in your home .
